過不下.definition: to be unable to continue living (in a certain manner); to be unable to make a living

過不去.definition: to make life difficult for; to embarrass; unable to make it through

過乾癮.definition: to satisfy a craving with substitutes

過了這個村就沒這個店.pinyin: guo4 le5 zhe4 ge5 cun1 jiu4 mei2 zhe4 ge5 dian4
過了這個村就沒這個店.definition: past this village, you won't find this shop (idiom); this is your last chance

過了這村沒這店.pinyin: guo4 le5 zhe4 cun1 mei2 zhe4 dian4
過了這村沒這店.definition: past this village, you won't find this shop (idiom); this is your last chance

過五關斬六將.pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
過五關斬六將.definition: lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom); fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)

過人.definition: to surpass others; outstanding; (basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent

過來人.definition: an experienced person; sb who has "been around (the block)"; sb who has personally experienced it

過刊.definition: back issue (abbr. for 過期刊物|过期刊物[guo4 qi1 kan1 wu4])

過剩.definition: to be excessive; to be more than is required

過勞死.definition: karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork

過勞肥.definition: overweight from overwork (the supposition that white collar workers become fat as a consequence of factors associated with being under pressure at work, including irregular diet, lack of exercise and inadequate rest)

過半.definition: over fifty percent; more than half

過問.definition: to show an interest in; to get involved with

過堂.definition: to appear in court for trial (old); (of Buddhist monks) to have a meal together in the temple hall

過場.definition: interlude; to cross the stage; to do sth as a mere formality; to go through the motions

過境.definition: to pass through a country's territory; transit

過失殺人.definition: see 過失致死罪|过失致死罪[guo4 shi1 zhi4 si3 zui4]

過孔.definition: (electronics) via (a type of hole in a circuit board)

過年.definition: to celebrate the Chinese New Year

過度.definition: excessive; over-; excess; going too far; extravagant; intemperate; overdue

過庭錄.definition: lit. Notes on Passing the Hall, historical jottings by 12th century Southern Song poet Fan Gongcheng 范公偁[Fan4 Gong1 cheng1], containing moral instructions derived from great men of Song dynasty

過往.definition: to come and go; to have friendly relations with; in the past; previous

過得.definition: How are you getting by?; How's life?; contraction of 過得去|过得去, can get by; tolerably well; not too bad

過得去.definition: lit. can pass through (an opening); fig. can get by (in life); tolerably well; not too bad; How are you getting by?; How's life?

過從.definition: to have relations with; to associate with

過慣.definition: to be accustomed to (a certain lifestyle etc)

過戶.definition: to transfer ownership (of a vehicle, securities etc); (real estate) conveyancing

過房.definition: to adopt; to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)

過日子.definition: to live one's life; to pass one's days; to get along

過早.definition: premature; untimely; (dialect) to have breakfast; breakfast

過時.definition: old-fashioned; out of date; to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon

過期.definition: to be overdue; to exceed the time limit; to expire (as in expiration date)

過橋米線.definition: rice noodle soup from Yunnan province

過氧化苯甲酰.pinyin: guo4 yang3 hua4 ben3 jia3 xian1

過水麵.definition: cooked noodles cooled with cold water

過河拆橋.definition: lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom); fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal

過活.definition: to live one's life; to make a living

過渡.definition: to cross over (by ferry); transition; interim; caretaker (administration)

過火.definition: to go too far; to go overboard (in words or actions); over the top; excessive; burned

過猶不及.definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)

過癮.definition: to satisfy a craving; to get a kick out of sth; gratifying; immensely enjoyable; satisfying; fulfilling

過目不忘.definition: to have a highly retentive memory; to have sth imprinted in one's memory

過硬.definition: to have perfect mastery of sth; to be up to the mark

過程.definition: course of events; process; CL:個|个[ge4]

過節.definition: to celebrate a festival; after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)

過篩.definition: to put through a sieve; to sift (flour etc); to strain (a liquid); (fig.) to screen; to filter; to select

過繼.definition: to adopt; to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)

過而能改，善莫大焉.pinyin: guo4 er2 neng2 gai3 , shan4 mo4 da4 yan1
過而能改，善莫大焉.definition: If one can change after making a mistake, there is nothing better (idiom)

過街老鼠.definition: sb or sth detested by all; target of scorn; anathema; cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]

過譽.definition: to praise too much; I really don't deserve so much praise

過門.definition: to pass through a doorway; (of a woman) to marry; orchestral music interlude in an opera

過關.definition: to cross a barrier; to get through (an ordeal); to pass (a test); to reach (a standard)

過關斬將.definition: to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom) (abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4])

過頭.definition: to overdo it; to overstep the limit; excessively; above one's head; overhead
